ITEM.name: IFWE Compass User Experience Adoption
ITEM.text: This section helps you to understand how to integrate your CAA applications into the 3DEXPERIENCE platform.

ITEM.name: IFWE Compass User Experience Novelties
ITEM.text: explains the novelties of the user interface.

ITEM.name: IFWE Compass User Experience Adoption Tips
ITEM.text: explains how to migrate your CAA applications so that they are properly integrated into the 3DEXPERIENCE platform.

ITEM.name: Migration of a CAA Geometry Sample
ITEM.text: explains the migration path for a use case of the CAA Geometry sample.

ITEM.name: Wintop Frame Overview
ITEM.text: explains the basics of interactivity and the main components of the interactive application main frame.

ITEM.name: Understanding the Wintop Frame Layout
ITEM.text: is a description of the objects involved in the interactive application main frame layout.

ITEM.name: Understanding the Wintop Frame Command Model
ITEM.text: is about the different types of commands and how they work.

ITEM.name: Command Headers
ITEM.text: explains how to make the link between commands and their representations in the interactive application frame

ITEM.name: Understanding the Command Headers
ITEM.text: describes the use of command headers.

ITEM.name: How to Create Standard Command Headers
ITEM.text: describes the ways to create standard command headers.

ITEM.name: Creating a Check Item
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a button which launches a command when the button is checked and another one when the button is unchecked.

ITEM.name: Creating a Combo Command Header
ITEM.text: is an example of associating a combo with a command header.

ITEM.name: Creating Editors in a Command
ITEM.text: is an example of associating an editor with a command header.

ITEM.name: Inserting Commands in Contextual Menus
ITEM.text: is an example of inserting commands in the contextual menu of an object when the Select command is the current command.

ITEM.name: Apps
ITEM.text: explains how to create apps

ITEM.name: Using Application Frame model classes
ITEM.text: How to use non exposed CATCmd prefixed classe in V6

ITEM.name: Creating an App
ITEM.text: is an example of creating an app, that is, an object that gathers commands and arranges them in the action bar

ITEM.name: Creating an Add-in
ITEM.text: is an example of creating an add-in to a given app.

ITEM.name: How to Create Resources for Apps
ITEM.text: describes how to create and store apps resources, such as title, help messages, and icons.

ITEM.name: How to Make Your Commands Available
ITEM.text: shows you how to integrate your command into the wintop frame.

ITEM.name: Making Your Data Independent Command Available in All Apps
ITEM.text: is an example of integrating a command that is available in all apps.

ITEM.name: Defining the Activated App
ITEM.text: is an example of making active the appropriate app when when an object is UI-activated.

ITEM.name: App Preferences
ITEM.text: explains how to create your own app preferences

ITEM.name: How to Add an App Preferences Tab
ITEM.text: describes how to create a new preferences tab for your app in the preferences command dialog box.

ITEM.name: Creating an App Preferences Tab
ITEM.text: is an example of creating app preferences in the preferences command dialog box.

ITEM.name: Object Edition and Properties
ITEM.text: details how to make your object editable, how to associate an object property dialog with them, and how to search for objects given a criterion based on such properties

ITEM.name: How to Add an Object Property Tab
ITEM.text: describes the steps to create a tab page for object properties.

ITEM.name: Creating a Property Tab for Your Objects
ITEM.text: is an example of property tab creation that enables to set texture properties onto objects

ITEM.name: Editing Objects
ITEM.text: is an example of making an object editable by implementing the CATIEdit interface and creating the contextual menu and the dialog box associated with this object to enable it to be edited.

ITEM.name: Search Overview
ITEM.text: explains how to search for objects matching a given criterion or a combination of criteria that might include Knowledge parameters.

ITEM.name: Creating Search Queries
ITEM.text: is an example that creates different kinds of criterion, launches the query based upon these criterion, and puts the found objects in the PSO (Prehighlighted Set of Objects).

ITEM.name: Tools Palette
ITEM.text: gives examples on how to use the Tools Palette.

ITEM.name: Creating a Command with Options in the Tools Palette
ITEM.text: is an example of enabling a command to add options in the Tools Palette.

ITEM.name: Using the Tools Palette for an App
ITEM.text: is an example of enabling an app to provide options in the Tools Palette as soon as it is activated.

ITEM.name: Contextual Help
ITEM.text: explains how to associate help information with your commands.

ITEM.name: How to Create Contextual Help
ITEM.text: describes how create a help file tree and how to set a link from a command to its dedicated help page.

ITEM.name: Creating Contextual Help for Your Add-on
ITEM.text: is an example of creating the structure and the contents of a help file tree for an Add-On on to the CATIA application.

ITEM.name: Tabs
ITEM.text: deals with different kinds of tabs and with cameras.

ITEM.name: Creating a Model's Tab - Part 1
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a new tab to display an existing representation.

ITEM.name: Creating a Model's Tab - Part 2
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a multi-viewer tab.

ITEM.name: Using Cameras
ITEM.text: is an example of using a camera to modify the current tab viewpoint.

ITEM.name: Creating an Interruptible Task
ITEM.text: is an example of a progress bar associated with a lengthy task that can be interrupted.
